oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tamme (XII)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tamme's own song about the ||noruko djo-djo (a kind of butterfly or moth) which he identifies in the south African Museum in January 1880. The song has not been translated. 1) See also Song of the sho sho and Song of the ||ku and Song of the !kan ||ka ||karashe and The song of the =ne=nebbi (woodpigeon) and The song of the sauko and The song of the mother of the little buck and The song of the =na=n'arro and The song of the Ngogan-a (a little bird) and The song of the !ke tsa'ba (a bird) and The song of the ||gani (a bird) and The song of the !korro-ssin !ku (or Pit-making Bushmen) and A song of the |kam-ssin !ku (or Sun Bushmen) and The song of the !na !na'rishe (a bird), 2) This is found in Book XI & XII-3.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd !kun notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The song of the ||noruko djo-djo
